Package edu.uiowa.cs.warp

Class ReliabilityAnalysis

java.lang.Object
edu.uiowa.cs.warp.ReliabilityAnalysis
public class ReliabilityAnalysis extends Object
ReliabilityAnalysis analyzes the end-to-end reliability of messages transmitted in flows for the WARP system.

Let M represent the Minimum Packet Reception Rate on an edge in a flow. The end-to-end reliability for each flow, flow:src->sink, is computed iteratively as follows:
(1)The flow:src node has an initial probability of 1.0 when it is released. All other initial probabilities are 0.0. (That is, the reset of the nodes in the flow have an initial probability value of 0.0.)
(2) each src->sink pair probability is computed as NewSinkNodeState = (1-M)*PrevSnkNodeState + M*PrevSrcNodeState
This value represents the probability that the message as been received by the node SinkNode. Thus, the NewSinkNodeState probability will increase each time a push or pull is executed with SinkNode as a listener.

The last probability state value for any node is the reliability of the message reaching that node, and the end-to-end reliability of a flow is the value of the last Flow:SinkNode probability.

CS2820 Spring 2023 Project: Implement this class to compute the probabilities the comprise the ReliablityMatrix, which is the core of the file visualization that is requested in Warp.

To do this, you will need to retrieve the program source, parse the instructions for each node, in each time slot, to extract the src and snk nodes in the instruction and then apply the message success probability equation defined above.

I recommend using the getInstructionParameters method of the WarpDSL class to extract the src and snk nodes from the instruction string in a program schedule time slot.

Version:
1.5 *
Author:
sgoddard

  • Method Details

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args)
      This is the main method used to test our implementation with Example1a.txt as the input file

    • getReliabilities

      public ReliabilityTable getReliabilities()
      This method returns the reliabilities instance variable if it is not null. otherwise it builds the reliabilities then returns them.
      Returns:
      a ReliabilityTable containing reliabilities of a packet reaching each node in a flow at each time slot

    • buildReliabilityTable

      public void buildReliabilityTable()
      This method calculates the probability that a package has made it to a node in the workload at every time slot and sets the reliabilities instance variable to a tables of these probabilities with the columns corresponding to a flow with a node and the rows a time slot

    • getColumnIndicesOfFlow

      public List<Integer> getColumnIndicesOfFlow(String flow, Map<String,Integer> map)
      This method takes in a flow and returns a list of integers that represent indices for columns in the reliability table where each index corresponds to a node in the flow the list is ordered such that the first element is the index for src node and last element is the index for the snk node
      Parameters:
      flow - name of the flow to get the ColumnIndicies of
      map - a map from : to the index of that column in the reliability table
      Returns:
      the indices of all columns that have a node in the flow, the first entry will be the src

    • getOldRow

      public ReliabilityRow getOldRow(int row, Map<String,Integer> map, ReliabilityTable reliabilities)
      Normally this method just returns the previous row in the reliabilities table to calculate the next set of probabilities. However, because sometimes a flow will resend its package the next set of calculations will have to be done with all the probabilities reset to 1 for the src node and 0 for all other nodes. This method also handles the case at the very beginning of the program and returns a row containing 1 for all src nodes and 0 everywhere else.
      Parameters:
      row - row in the Schedule
      map - association from : to the index of that column
      reliabilities - ReliabilityTable that is being created
      Returns:
      ReliabilityRow to use for the next probability calculations

    • getFlowNamesToResend

      public List<String> getFlowNamesToResend(int row)
      Since each flow has a period, sometimes a flow is able to send multiple messages during one program cycle since other flows have much longer periods. This method takes in the time slot of the program and calculates what flows should resend their message.
      Parameters:
      row - the index of row in the Reliabilities table
      Returns:
      List of flow names that are going to be resent

    • getFlowNodeToColumnAssociation

      public Map<String,Integer> getFlowNodeToColumnAssociation()
      This method creates a Map that will pair each : association to a column index for the ReliabilityTable such that the columns will match up with the column header created in the ReliabilityVisualization class
      Returns:
      Mapinvalid input: '<'String, Integer> representing the association from : to column index

    • getNumRows

      public int getNumRows()
      This method returns an integer representing the number of rows in the getReliabilities table. It is found by calculating the number of time slots in the program.
      Returns:
      int number of rows

    • getNumColumns

      public int getNumColumns()
      This method returns an integer representing the number of columns in the getReliabilities table. It is found by adding up all the nodes in each flow
      Returns:
      int number of columns

    • verifyReliabilities

      public boolean verifyReliabilities()
      This method declares whether all flows meet their minimum E2E reliabilities by comparing each node's e2e reliability at the last time slot in the ReliabilityTable to the program's minimum e2e, and prints messages identifying all flows/nodes that do not meet the minimum e2e
      Returns:
      boolean representing whether all flows meet the minimum e2e reliability

    • getFinalReliabilityRow

      public ArrayList<Double> getFinalReliabilityRow()
      This method returns the final row of the ReliabilityTable representing the probabilities that a package has arrived at each node at the final time slot
      Returns:
      ArrayList containing all entries from the last row of the ReliabilityTable

    • getColumnToFlowNodeAssociation

      public Map<Integer,String> getColumnToFlowNodeAssociation()
      This method creates a Map that will pair each column index to a : association for the ReliabilityTable such that the columns will match up with the column header created in the ReliabilityVisualization class Modified from getFlowNodeToColumnAssociation() to create a hashmap with the column indices as keys and : strings as values for easier access in verifyReliabilities()
      Returns:
      Mapinvalid input: '<'Integer, String> representing the association from column index to :

    • numTxPerLinkAndTotalTxCost

      public ArrayList<Integer> numTxPerLinkAndTotalTxCost(Flow flow)
      This method calculates a flow's numTxPerLinkAndTotalTxCost based on whether its fault tolerance is fixed. If useFixedTx is true, it calculates the maximum number of transmissions per link and maximum total transmissions. If useFixedTx is false, it calculates the number of transmission attempts (pushes) per link and total transmission attempts.
      Parameters:
      flow - is the specified flow to calculate transmissions and cost for
      Returns:
      an ArrayList containing the number of transmissions per link and total cost of the specified flow

    • getNumTxAttemptsPerLinkAndTotalTxAttempts

      public ArrayList<Integer> getNumTxAttemptsPerLinkAndTotalTxAttempts(Flow flow)
      Returns the number of transmission attempts per link and the total transmission attempts of a flow with the specified end-to-reliability and minimum packet reception rate.
      Parameters:
      flow - Name of the requested flow
      Returns:
      ArrayList containing the flow nodes, number of transmission attempts per link and total number of transmission attempts

    • getFixedTxPerLinkAndTotalTxCost

      public ArrayList<Integer> getFixedTxPerLinkAndTotalTxCost(Flow flow)
      Returns the total transmissions per link and the total cost of the requested flow with the specified number of faults.
      Parameters:
      flow - Name of the requested flow
      Returns:
      ArrayList containing the flow nodes, number of transmission and total transmission cost
